cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (Potential Tropical Cyclone Three – 45 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast tonight, then forecast to sweep northeast across Alabama and Georgia and reach the western Carolinas/Atlantic late Sunday–Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana coastline east of Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect; watches limited to the northern Gulf coast.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from east of Morgan City, LA, to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA–FL Panhandle) with inland impacts spreading across MS, AL, GA, and western SC
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible late Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of locally heavy rain possible Sunday into Monday, with brief urban/poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat inland over GA/SC as the remnant low passes; thunderstorms may briefly halt port operations.
